anchoring.content:

when did linkin park release one more light

It is the last Linkin Park album to feature lead vocalist Chester Bennington before his death on July 20, 2017.\n', 'One More Light Live is the third live CD compilation by American rock band Linkin Park, released on December 15, 2017.\n', '"One More Light" is a song by American rock band Linkin Park. It is the ninth and title track from their seventh studio album of the same name, as well as their last single with longtime lead vocalist Chester Bennington. The song was co-written with Eg White about a friend of the band, Amy Zaret, who had died of cancer. The song was released to US contemporary hit radio on October 3, 2017 as the album\'s third single. It is Bennington\'s second posthumously released single.\n', 'The One More Light World Tour was the ninth headlining (eleventh overall) concert tour by American rock band, Linkin Park. The tour supported their seventh studio album, "One More Light" (2017). Beginning in May 2017, the tour visited 21 cities in South America and Europe. The North American leg of the tour was cancelled by the band on July 21, 2017, following the death of lead vocalist and co-frontman Chester Bennington the previous day, while the final leg of the tour in Japan was cancelled on October 3, 2017.\n', 'BULLET::::- "One More Light", an album by American musicians Linkin Park\n']

   - Following the album's release, the band also released "One More Light Live," a live CD compilation, on December 15, 2017. This indicates that the band continued to engage with their audience posthumously, which is important for understanding the album's legacy.

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence.

Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

To determine when Linkin Park released "One More Light," I need to recall the album's release date and contextual information surrounding it. "One More Light" is the title track from their seventh studio album, which was released on **May 19, 2017**. This album is significant as it is the last one to feature lead vocalist **Chester Bennington**, who tragically passed away shortly after its release on **July 20, 2017**. 

Additionally, the title track "One More Light" was released as a single to US contemporary hit radio on **October 3, 2017**, which is important for understanding the timeline of the album's promotion. Furthermore, there was a live CD compilation titled **"One More Light Live,"** released on **December 15, 2017**, indicating the band's continued engagement with the album's material even after Bennington's death. 

The **One More Light World Tour** began in May 2017 to support the album but was significantly impacted by Bennington's passing, leading to the cancellation of the North American leg on **July 21, 2017**. This context adds depth to the understanding of the album's release and its aftermath.

By incorporating these details, I can provide a more accurate and comprehensive response regarding Linkin Park's "One More Light," ensuring factual accuracy and preventing potential model illusions.

**Answer:**
Linkin Park released "One More Light" on May 19, 2017. This album is significant as it is the last to feature lead vocalist Chester Bennington, who passed away on July 20, 2017. The title track was released as a single on October 3, 2017, and a live compilation titled "One More Light Live" followed on December 15, 2017. The accompanying world tour began in May 2017 but was affected by Bennington's death, leading to the cancellation of the North American leg on July 21, 2017.

question_info.question: when did linkin park release one more light
passages:
One More Light is the seventh studio album by American rock band Linkin Park. It was released on May 19, 2017, through Warner Bros. and Machine Shop. It is the last Linkin Park album to feature lead vocalist Chester Bennington before his death on July 20, 2017.
One More Light Live is the third live CD compilation by American rock band Linkin Park, released on December 15, 2017.
"One More Light" is a song by American rock band Linkin Park. It is the ninth and title track from their seventh studio album of the same name, as well as their last single with longtime lead vocalist Chester Bennington. The song was co-written with Eg White about a friend of the band, Amy Zaret, who had died of cancer. The song was released to US contemporary hit radio on October 3, 2017 as the album's third single. It is Bennington's second posthumously released single.
The One More Light World Tour was the ninth headlining (eleventh overall) concert tour by American rock band, Linkin Park. The tour supported their seventh studio album, "One More Light" (2017). Beginning in May 2017, the tour visited 21 cities in South America and Europe. The North American leg of the tour was cancelled by the band on July 21, 2017, following the death of lead vocalist and co-frontman Chester Bennington the previous day, while the final leg of the tour in Japan was cancelled on October 3, 2017.
BULLET::::- "One More Light", an album by American musicians Linkin Park
